summary: Jaundice is when your skin and eyes look yellow or green. It happens because of too much bilirubin, a yellow substance made when red blood cells break down. In adults, jaundice is usually a sign of a serious health problem like liver disease or a blocked bile duct. Babies often get jaundice, but it usually goes away on its own. Treatment depends on the cause. It might include medicine, surgery, or special lights for babies.
title: Jaundice
